posts.title: Domain change
posts.text: I lost my cloudflare and namecheap account after i reset my yubikey‚Äôs fido applet because macos gpg tools was being extremely bad at handlingssh fido keys and gpg, resulting in my yubikey not being usable as a smartcard in macos, which was the only os i had access to(found out about t2linux much MUCH later). i had to ssh into multiple servers and my key was the only option. fuck you apple. anyways, i bought a new domain after the kcomain.dev domain was about to expire coincidentally (like a week earlier). it is this domain, soopy.moe.i don‚Äôt control the kcomain.dev domain anymore, please do not send any more emails to that address because i will not be reading them (improvmx onlyallows 1 domain at a time and setting it up is a major chore) haven‚Äôt got the time to setup all the old stuff back to my current domain (tbh most of the old stuff are not working anyways so you shouldn‚Äôt need to care) a list of my currently open services can be found here

posts.title: we love hp
posts.text: sometimes linux just doesn‚Äôt work and you have a hard time finding why. this happened to my friend today because theirpc doesn‚Äôt work well with linux. it took them like 3 days before figuring out a possible solution. their problem was every single distro shows a black screen and nothing else. They tried Ubuntu, Endeavour and Manjaroand all gave them the black screen treatment. Solution: add noapic to kernel command line.

posts.title: openssh update
posts.text: Another month, another update. This time, OpenSSH decided to add a key-exchangealgorithm that just so happens to break my GPG+YubiKey ssh setup. Said kex algorithm is sntrup761x25519-sha512@openssh.com. If you don‚Äôt removeit, any attempts to connect to the server with the ‚Äúcurrent‚Äù yubikey (I have a5.2.7 yubikey) will result in the scdaemon spitting a not-at-all helpful errormessage at you: 1gpg-agent[1074]: scdaemon[1074]: app_auth failed: Invalid value This was a bit confusing and took me a while to figure out why it happens^2, evenwith gpg-agent set to output all information possible. Solution^1: 12# /etc/ssh/sshd_config+ KexAlgorithms -sntrup761x25519-sha512@openssh.com It‚Äôs worth noting that this config only applies to sshd. If you‚Äôre a client tryingto connect to a remote server that doesn‚Äôt have this, it will not work. I‚Äôm not sureif this is patched yet.
